comment_text: I get my migraines and passes them on to my son. I also get exercise induced migraines... Horrible!! I used to give my self imitrex injections and used tablet form also but one day I took Excedrin when I was desperate and 15 minutes later...POOF💨 GONE! my son now takes Excedrin too and it also works for him. If you suffer from migraines, try it. You won't believe it!

I’ve had migraines since I was 10 and I’ve suffered from them, I’m now 12 and I & haven’t had one in a couple months. Some people in my class say “yeah I get migraines too your just exaggerating. Take a nap and then you’ll wake up fine” when people say that, I just freeze. I get so mad at them because they don’t understand the pain I go through whenever I get one. It’s NOT just a headache. I see random lines and have the worst headache ever. I throw up and these can last (for my case) 8 hours - 2 days. It’s the worst. Some people just don’t get it

Every migraine sufferer knows the one thing that just might be worse than the migraine itself, and that's the unsolicited medical advice every a-hole has when they find out you are currently suffering from a migraine. I can't be the only one that has seriously contemplated murder...

My mother mailed LAVENDER! It stunk up the whole mailbox! It went straight into the garbage. NO. Just NO! Keep your damn scents to yourself, people!

I inherited migraines from my husband. They went away when we got divorced. I shit you not. I'll explain:

He inherited it from his mother and father. 4 years after meeting him, I got my first migraine, and it lasted 10 days. Next thing I know, I'm seeing the same neurologist and am on the same medication regimen that included 120 Percs per month! Before long, I'm taking Percs every single day because I'm having daily migraines and the preventive meds and rescue meds aren't working.

Long story short, after we got divorced and I lost that health insurance causing me to lose that neurologist and, specifically that Percocet prescription, my migraines went away!

Now, I might get the tiniest migraine, a few times a year, but they're so mild, simply relaxing in a quiet place is enough to get rid of it.
It is agony and really makes me hate bright light // loud noises // being touched! I have had one for close to a week and can't wait to see my neurologist.
Can you talk more about this? Maybe even some things that can work or ease the pain. Thank you both for all that you do. You’ve taught me so much, I really appreciate it
That valley girl accent sure is making a come back
I get migraines not as bad as some people. Some people gut them worst than me.

As someone who gets them frequently they suck...I had one day where broccoli and chicken smelled like fish, my girlfriends hair smelled of spices, cheese apparently tasted like mustard (I hate that taste, and when my girlfriend folded the sandwich in half decreasing the cheese it was okay, but then the bread tasted like mold. On bad days I want nothing but quiet and darkness. Sometimes all I can do is take weed to decrease the sensitivity and just try to sleep...that is if the 'soft spot' on my head that feels like I was hit by a bat isn't sensitive to the point of me not being able to get comfy enough to sleep....don't even get me started with the constant nausea and on bad days the fun part of vomiting. Yes I have safe foods because unfortunately if it's not in that category there is a 50/50 I won't be able to eat what is made and that's a really shitty feeling 😕. Migraines suck and I didn't know it stems from Genetics and is sped up via injury...guess it makes sense that it occurred when I got my TBI 😔 life really isn't the same and I can't do what I was able to and it really cut my 20's short...on the plus side I retired at 25.....I guess~ not really the pain trade off is horrendous!

Also an important thing is that migraines aren’t all the same condition-wise. A lot of people will have a bad headache and call it a “migraine.” But normally, the attacks can be anywhere from hours to days long. For me, I usually have short attacks with aura. I get severe pain, chills, nausea, and light and sound sensitivity. I eventually throw up after a few hours where all I can do to manage and control the attack is lay down in the dark and try to sleep. It is not fun

I kept thinking it's just a headache... When it got to the point when it was daily, I felt like I'm gonna throw up just from the pain and I started losing vision for several minutes at a time, I finally visited a doctor and she was like "uhh... duh! you have migraines!"

What really got me was that I told her I have them daily and she gave me some pills... 6 of them! I do understand that they're strong (she gave me other pills to take before the migraine pills so that my body doesn't just randomly decide to throw up from how strong they are) but still... 6? So I ended up waiting for the migraine to get REALLY bad before I took one because I felt like I need to save them... :D

There's also other disorders that causes migraines come are swelling if vessels where as some are from swelling muscles which cause swelling vessels. That's simplified but I also have chronic migraine with fibromyalgia and ME/CFS

I didn't realize this was something that happened to a lot of people

Headaches are unexplainable unfortunately. You can have a severe headache that seems like a migraine but it's still technically just a headache.
Unlike migraines that are super intense headaches caused by misfiring of neurons and found in genetics.
I was always explained that migraines are something doctors can physically see and analyze, while a headache you really can't. Tylenol is known to help relieve a headache but it most likely won't do much for someone in the middle of a migraine.

Many genes can be turned on or off with changes, like diet. I had them for a long time, along with my parents, and after going mostly whole food plant-based I only get them when consuming too much processed sugar or animal protein.

Got migraines throughout pregnancy and couldn’t recognize any “trigger” except probably increase in hormones 😩 so not much could be done! Oh man and waaaay more than a headache- I would get blind spots, and numbness, and forget words and not be able to talk properly. I thought I was stroking out or was pre-eclamptic! But no… “sorry just hormones.”

scientifically, the brain prefers glucose for fuel and when there's a fuel deficiency  = migraine. But if you fast regularly and get your brain accustomed to using ketones for fuel you will suffer fewer migraines. Thus why carbs trigger migraines - bcz you have made yourself susceptible via your diet .. which you learned from your parents. So, change. Change your diet so you'll suffer less. You'll suffer fewer migraines by behaving as an adult and making appropriate changes.

My biggest tip for getting rid of or taking the edge off a migraine is to put Himalayan pink salt under your tongue and letting it dissolve. A neurological misfire? Like having a seizure? I've had both, though seizures aren't painful unless they can make your body do something painful. I have a VERY fuzzy memory from being in hospital with seizures where, at my worst, my body was balanced on my heels and the top of my head (I was lying on my back, and YES, it hurts to gt into that position, especially involuntarily and without using your hands). I don't remember much at all that well from that point. Only a few not-very-lucid bits and bites for about a week. They had me medically knocked out, of course, till they could fix me up. Migraines, though, ugh, those are a b*tch. You're totally awake and in crushing pain. My mom gets them, too. Poor mama.
